name: Private Cloud
description: SEC-reported revenue segment encompassing managed private cloud infrastructure including VMware-based SDDC solutions (Enterprise, Business, Flex, Anywhere, SAP variants), Rackspace OpenStack Private Cloud, managed hosting (bare metal dedicated servers), colocation services, Private Cloud AI platforms, data storage, and RackConnect Global connectivity. VMware Cloud Service Provider Pinnacle partner. FY2024 revenue of $1,055 million (down 13% YoY). Private Cloud offerings are generally sold under multi-year contracts averaging three years with monthly recurring revenue. Typical contract lengths range from 18 to 36 months per SEC 10-K Item 1.

name: Public Cloud
description: SEC-reported revenue segment encompassing managed services and professional services for hyperscale public cloud platforms: Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Delivered through Elastic Engineering pods, Modern Operations 24x7x365 support, consulting and advisory services, professional services, and FAIR AI services. FY2024 revenue of $1,683 million (down 3% YoY). Public Cloud revenue is primarily generated from recurring monthly fees for managed services and variable fees for professional services engagements. 15 AWS competencies, 2,700+ AWS certifications, 500+ GCP certifications.

name: Foundry for AI by Rackspace (FAIR)
description: Global AI services practice launched June 2023 dedicated to accelerating business transformation through responsible AI adoption. Three-phase methodology: Ideate (goal-setting and feasibility evaluation), Incubate (technology stack establishment and first AI solution creation), and Industrialize (production scaling with governance and metrics). Has identified over 500 use cases across multiple industries per June 2025 Sema4.ai partnership announcement. Led by President of AI, Technology and Sustainability Srini Koushik. Platform-agnostic delivery across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Accelerator products include ICE (Intelligent Co-worker for the Enterprise) and RITA (Rackspace Intelligent Technology Assistant). Available in AWS Marketplace.

name: Rackspace Elastic Engineering
description: Core managed and professional services delivery model launched April 14, 2021 providing on-demand access to dedicated pods of nine certified cloud experts per pod (engagement manager, lead cloud architect, senior cloud engineers). Delivered as recurring monthly service with no long-term commitments through agile Engagement Delivery Framework using weekly sprint cycles. Customers gain fractional access via hours-based tiers that scale up and down monthly. Pods remain dedicated to individual customers for deep environment familiarity. Five variants: for Hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP), for VMware, for Security, for Microsoft 365, and for Government. Revenue per employee exceeds $500,000 per 10-K filing. CTO Tolga Tarhan described it as a new category in cloud services combining operational expertise with cloud native engineering.

name: Rackspace Elastic Engineering for Security
description: Security-specific Elastic Engineering variant launched August 24, 2021. Dedicated security pod includes engagement manager, pod lead, lead architect, security architects, security engineers, compliance expert, and security analysts/penetration testers. Covers security architecture and engineering (defense-in-depth across multicloud including AWS, Azure, VMware, and Rackspace environments), risk management and remediation, and advanced monitoring and resolution with 24x7x365 operational support. Team holds 800+ security certifications including 100+ cloud security certificates and Global Information Assurance Certifications (GIACs) in Cyber Defense, Digital Forensics and Incident Response, and Penetration Testing. Available on AWS Marketplace.

name: Rackspace Elastic Engineering for VMware
description: VMware-specific Elastic Engineering variant providing dedicated VMware expert pods for modernization of workloads on VMware without disruption to platform and team. Leverages Rackspace's position as VMware Cloud Service Provider Pinnacle partner. Covers migration to Rackspace data centers, third-party data centers, or hyperscale clouds supporting VMware. Supports Broadcom's updated VMware Cloud Foundation licensing framework.

name: Rackspace Elastic Engineering for Microsoft 365
description: Microsoft 365-specific Elastic Engineering variant providing dedicated pods for enterprise Microsoft 365 environments. Covers governance, change management, Data Loss Prevention, Cloud App Security, Identity Protection, Insider Threat Protection, and feature adoption optimization. Engineers collaborate in sprint cycles for proactive security safeguards and ROI-driven application management. Built on 25+ year Microsoft partnership. Rackspace recognized as Microsoft strategic partner in Data and AI, and Ready-Tier partner for Copilot Jumpstart per 10-K.

name: Rackspace Elastic Engineering for Government
description: Government-specific Elastic Engineering variant announced for government cloud professionals. Leverages NIST cloud computing essential characteristics: Broad Access (dedicated pod with engagement manager), Rapid Elasticity (team scaling up and down with demand), On-Demand (supplement or offload tasks), Resource Pooling (US-only distributed workforce). Supports FedRAMP-authorized Rackspace Government Cloud environments on AWS.

name: Rackspace Modern Operations
description: 24x7x365 managed cloud operations service providing phone- and ticket-based operational and systems administration support. Built on ITIL framework and ITSM methodology powered by ServiceNow. Supports environments across AWS, Azure, GCP, on-premises, and Rackspace Private Cloud. Combines integrated ITIL-compliant processes with DevOps transformational work. Listed as distinct service on rackspace.com. Available as standalone or combined with Elastic Engineering.

name: Rackspace Managed Cloud
description: Fully outsourced management and operations of enterprise cloud environments. End-to-end cloud service management based on ITIL framework with single-pane-of-glass control for comprehensive view of cloud resources. Supports hybrid cloud deployments with DevOps services for transformational projects. Includes change, knowledge, and deployment management. Listed as distinct service on rackspace.com under Cloud Solutions.

name: Cloud Adoption and Migration Services
description: Cloud migration portfolio including Rackspace Rapid Migration Offer (RRMO) available on AWS Marketplace, Migration and Modernization Center of Excellence, platform migrations for VM-based workloads, lift-and-shift migrations, pipeline-driven migrations, and landing zone implementations. Expanded scope under multi-year AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement (SCA) signed October 2024 covering advisory, migration, modernization, data, ML, and generative AI solutions.

name: Cloud Optimization and FinOps Services
description: Financial operations practice for cloud cost management including Optimizer+ platform (tailored recommendations, platform support, custom reporting), FinOps Core Accelerator (four-month consultative sprint engagement), and GainShare value-based engagement model with guaranteed savings. Provides cloud financial analysts, cost allocation tagging, resource utilization optimization, and ongoing spend tracking. Referenced on rackspace.com as Cloud FinOps.

name: Rackspace SDDC Solutions
description: VMware Cloud Foundation-based software-defined data center product line. Five variants: SDDC Enterprise (full VCF on hyperconverged infrastructure), SDDC Business (hosted VMware workloads), SDDC Flex (consumption-based pricing), SDDC Anywhere (on-premises deployment at customer site), SDDC for SAP (certified SAP single-tenant platform). VMware Cloud Service Provider Pinnacle partner status. All include bundled VMware licenses per Broadcom VCSP framework effective November 2025. Supports DRaaS via SDDC Flex Disaster Recovery as a Service.

name: Rackspace OpenStack Private Cloud
description: Enterprise-grade private cloud built on OpenStack, co-founded by Rackspace with NASA in 2010. Offers Rackspace-based open-source and Red Hat OpenStack configurations. 99.99% OpenStack API uptime guarantee with 15-minute emergency response SLA. Over one billion server hours managing OpenStack clouds. Deployable in Rackspace data centers, customer facilities, or third-party colocation. Average 35% platform cost reduction versus alternatives. Branded as 'Rackspace OpenStack Enterprise' on rackspace.com.

name: Rackspace Managed Hosting
description: Dedicated bare metal hosting services providing maximum uptime, visibility, security, and control. Includes managed servers, databases, storage, and VMware environments optimized per customer workloads. Two service tiers: Managed and Intensive. Supports PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and FISMA compliance. 24x7x365 expert support. Listed under Platforms > Cloud as 'Managed Hosting' on rackspace.com.

name: Rackspace Colocation Services
description: Data center colocation enabling customers to deploy own infrastructure in Rackspace facilities. Carrier-neutral with average eight carriers per data center. Pricing per kilowatt for power reservation. Seamless cross-connects to public/private cloud via RackConnect. Robust public cloud ecosystem with direct connections to AWS, Azure, Google, and Alibaba via RackConnect. IDC MarketScape Major Player for Colocation and Interconnection Services. Available globally in data centers across US (Chicago, Dallas, Kansas City, Northern New Jersey, Northern Virginia, San Jose), Hong Kong, London, Moscow, and Sydney.

name: RackConnect Global
description: Private network connectivity product securely connecting Rackspace dedicated hosting environments to other data center locations and private/public clouds including AWS, Microsoft Azure, OpenStack, VMware, and Google Cloud. 99.95% connectivity uptime guarantee. 24x7x365 support. Enables customers to ride Rackspace private network to lower connectivity costs, improve resilience, and improve data privacy. Listed as distinct platform on rackspace.com.

name: Rackspace Data Storage
description: Storage solutions portfolio including block storage, cloud backup, custom data storage (SAS, SAN, NAS), object storage, and content delivery. Includes managed backup services and shared storage arrays available to colocation and managed hosting customers. Listed as distinct platform under Platforms > Cloud on rackspace.com.

name: Rackspace Government Cloud
description: FedRAMP-authorized Platform-as-a-Service for government agencies and technology providers selling to government. Built on Zero Trust security architecture on AWS. Fully managed security and compliance automation addressing up to 80% of NIST SP 800-53 controls. Up to 70% operational cost savings versus building from scratch. Founding member of Cloud Security Alliance. Includes Elastic Engineering for Government variant. Led by Rackspace Government Solutions, Inc. subsidiary.

name: Rackspace Spot
description: Cloud infrastructure auctioned in an open market, delivered as turnkey, fully managed Kubernetes clusters. Distinct product with dedicated domain at spot.rackspace.com. Listed under both Solutions > Cloud Technology and Platforms > Cloud on rackspace.com. Operates as distinct organizational unit (ou-045).

name: Rackspace Private Cloud AI
description: Suite of AI offerings for private cloud enabling AI/ML workloads in secure dedicated environments. Includes Rackspace AI Anywhere (edge-deployable, announced January 2024) and Rackspace AI Business (private cloud AI platform for large-scale model training). Powered by FAIR methodology, integrated with Dell Technologies and NVIDIA ecosystems including H100 Tensor Core GPUs, DGX platforms, and Run.ai scheduling. Supports fine-tuning, inferencing, and full production deployment. Listed as distinct platform on rackspace.com under both AI and Cloud.

name: AWS Managed and Professional Services
description: Comprehensive AWS services portfolio backed by multi-year Strategic Collaboration Agreement (SCA) signed October 2024 covering advisory, migration, modernization, data, ML, and generative AI solutions. AWS Premier Consulting Partner. ISG Provider Lens Leader in four categories: Professional Services, Managed Services, Data Analytics AI and ML, and SAP Workloads (2024). 15+ AWS competencies including DevOps, Cloud Operations (Financial Management and Governance), SMB, Healthcare, Higher Education, Financial Services, Industrial Software, IoT, Machine Learning, Migration, Data Analytics, Generative AI, and Automotive. 2,700+ AWS certifications. AWS MAP Partner. AWS Marketplace Premier Consulting Partner authorized to negotiate private ISV offers. Rackspace Rapid Migration Offer (RRMO) available in AWS Marketplace. Migration and Modernization Center of Excellence. Award: AWS SI Partner of the Year NAMER 2023.

name: Microsoft Azure Managed and Professional Services
description: Managed and professional services for Microsoft Azure environments including migration, modernization, security, and ongoing operations. IDC MarketScape Major Player for European Microsoft Azure Managed Services 2025. ISG Provider Lens Leader for Microsoft AI and Cloud Ecosystem Global 2025. Microsoft Gold Partner and six-time Hosting Partner of the Year. Microsoft Azure Expert MSP designation. Microsoft strategic partner in Data and AI per 10-K. Copilot Jumpstart Ready-Tier partner. Delivered through Elastic Engineering and Modern Operations models.

name: Google Cloud Managed and Professional Services
description: Managed services for Google Cloud Platform as Google Cloud's first Premier Managed Services Partner. 500+ Google Cloud technical certifications. ISG Provider Lens Leader for Google Cloud Partner Ecosystem 2025. Google Cloud Partner of the Year for Breakthrough (2018), Infrastructure (2019), Migration (2018). Delivered through Elastic Engineering for GCP, FAIR on Google Cloud, and migration services.

name: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Services
description: Managed services for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure as designated Oracle Cloud Solutions Provider (CSP). 300+ certified Oracle experts with 600+ completed projects over 20 years. Includes Oracle E-Business Suite, PeopleSoft, and Oracle application migration and management on OCI, private cloud, hyperscale, or on-premises. Rackspace is an Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN) member with Cloud Service track. Listed as distinct partner platform on rackspace.com.

name: VMware Solutions
description: Managed services for VMware environments as VMware Cloud Service Provider Pinnacle partner. Encompasses SDDC Solutions product line, Elastic Engineering for VMware, VMware Cloud Foundation managed services, and VMware HCX integration for hybrid cloud mobility. Supports Broadcom's updated VCSP licensing framework with bundled licenses. VMware 2023 Lifecycle Services Award for Americas Region per 10-K. Delivers Rackspace Services for VMware Cloud (registered trademark per 10-K). 15+ years VMware workload management.

name: Dell Technologies Alliance Solutions
description: Strategic alliance with Dell Technologies spanning 20+ years. Delivers Dell Generative AI Solutions powered by FAIR with Dell infrastructure and NVIDIA software. Dell Technologies Global Alliances Service Provider of the Year Americas (2024 per 10-K). Dell Titanium CSP Partner. Four-time Dell Technologies Partner of the Year. Dell Technologies Excellence in Server and Storage Sales Americas (2023 per 10-K). Covers outcome-based customer engagements combining Rackspace cloud services with Dell infrastructure.

name: Application Modernization Services
description: Professional services for application transformation including application portfolio assessment, business process transformation, DevOps engineering (CI/CD, automated performance monitoring), service management consulting, and cloud operating model design. Deep-dive application reviews to determine modernize, replace, retire, or consolidate paths with solution roadmap.

name: Cloud Native Services
description: Services for delivering auto-scaling and hyper-resilient cloud native applications. Covers container orchestration, serverless architectures, microservices development, and cloud native enablement. Application Discovery and Wireframing Assessment with business analysts and architects.

name: IoT and Edge Computing Services
description: Design, build, and modernization of IoT devices and applications from prototype to production. Includes hardware engineering for connected smart devices with reference designs, cloud platform development for secure bidirectional device communication, and edge computing solutions. Verticals: Healthcare (HIPAA, GDPR, GxP compliant connected medical devices and digital therapeutics), Industrial IoT (connected factory, asset tracking, predictive maintenance analytics). Data architecture design with custom analytics and ML models.

name: Application Operations Services
description: Ongoing operation and optimization of cloud-based applications in production environments. Covers application performance monitoring, management, optimization, and SaaS Lifecycle Management for high-value low-complexity applications. Listed as distinct services under Solutions > Applications on rackspace.com.

name: Microsoft 365 and Productivity Services
description: End-to-end productivity solutions powered by Microsoft 365 including Elastic Engineering for Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 Copilot enablement, and Microsoft SharePoint services. 25+ year Microsoft partnership. Microsoft six-time Hosting Partner of the Year. Operated through Rackspace Email and Productivity Services unit (ou-080). Covers governance, Data Loss Prevention, Cloud App Security, Identity Protection, Insider Threat Protection.

name: Rackspace Email
description: Turnkey business-class email hosting powered by Rackspace Technology. Originally established through 2007 acquisition of Webmail.us. Accessed via Cloud Office Control Panel (cp.rackspace.com) and Rackspace Webmail portal (apps.rackspace.com). Operated through Rackspace Cloud Office LLC subsidiary (ou-063). Listed as distinct product on rackspace.com.

name: ERP Services
description: Managed services for enterprise resource planning platforms including SAP (SAP Silver Partner per professional services page), Oracle (Oracle PartnerNetwork member), and Microsoft Dynamics 365. Includes SDDC for SAP (certified SAP single-tenant private cloud platform). Modernization of ERP solutions on optimized cloud infrastructure. Listed under both Solutions > Applications and Platforms > Applications on rackspace.com.

name: CRM Services
description: Advisory, professional, and managed services for CRM platforms including Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Salesforce (Salesforce Platinum Consulting Partner per professional services page). Listed under Solutions > Applications and Platforms > Applications on rackspace.com.

name: Digital Experience Services
description: Expertise for customer experience application platforms including Adobe Experience Manager and Sitecore. Deployment, management, and optimization of digital experience platforms. Listed under Platforms > Applications on rackspace.com.

name: Data Modernization Services
description: Data architecture assessment, cloud data platform implementation, data pipeline automation, database modernization, business intelligence modernization, operating model and governance design, and analytics with applied AI. DataOps team providing 24x7x365 automated pipeline monitoring. SQL conversion and migration with cloud native tooling. ISG Provider Lens Leader for AWS Data Analytics AI and ML (2024).

name: AI and Machine Learning Services
description: Enhanced analytics powered by AI/ML including model development, training, deployment, and management. Covers predictive analytics, machine learning operations, and AI-powered data processing. Separate from FAIR (pf-003) which focuses on generative and agentic AI; this service covers traditional ML and analytics use cases. Listed under Solutions > Data.

name: Data Strategy and Governance Services
description: Services for protecting and governing data assets for better business outcomes. Covers data classification, data lifecycle management, governance frameworks, and compliance alignment. Listed under Solutions > Data on rackspace.com.

name: Database Platform Services
description: Database deployment, management, and optimization across relational databases (Oracle, MS SQL, MySQL), NoSQL platforms (MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis clusters), and Database as a Service (DBaaS). Operated through Rackspace DBaaS organizational unit (ou-105) and ObjectRocket LLC subsidiary (ou-088) for NoSQL. Database Specialists LLC subsidiary (ou-090). Listed under Platforms > Data on rackspace.com.

name: Next-Gen Data Platform Services
description: Services for next-generation cloud data platforms: AWS Data, Google Cloud Data, Microsoft Azure Data, and Snowflake. Acquired Just Analytics Pte Ltd (ou-051) in January 2022 for $62 million to expand data analytics capabilities per 10-K. ISG Leader recognition in data analytics across multiple platforms.

name: Analytics Platform Services
description: Services spanning data lakes, business intelligence, data warehouses, big data processing, and analytics platforms. Branded 'Just Analytics' on rackspace.com reflecting acquisition of Just Analytics Pte Ltd. Listed under Platforms > Data.

name: Cyber Recovery Services
description: Services for strengthening cyber resilience with recovery-as-code methodology. Rubrik-powered solutions with immutable backups, zero-trust architecture, and single protection policy across multiple cloud environments. Automated response playbooks, scheduled DR drills, architectural lifecycle management, and 24x7x365 multicloud support. Meets enterprise RTOs through intelligent workload automation and DevOps practices.

name: Cyber Recovery Cloud powered by Rubrik
description: Managed platform for restoring critical business operations in hours. Rackspace and Rubrik partnership for public cloud cyber resilience. Clean data through immutable backups and zero-trust architecture. Listed as distinct technology product under both Solutions > Cyber Security and Platforms > Security on rackspace.com.

name: Security Strategy Services
description: Security posture assessment and cybersecurity strategy roadmap development. Covers gap assessment, security architecture review, detailed security roadmap with compliance alignment, and security maturity evaluation. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security on rackspace.com.

name: Detection and Response Services
description: Cloud vulnerability detection and mitigation services for rapid threat identification and response. Advanced monitoring and resolution with 24x7x365 operational support, security automation, pre-defined runbooks, and security help desk. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security on rackspace.com.

name: Cloud Native Security Services
description: Cloud native security services from design to production. Expert services for reinforcing security of cloud applications and data across the development lifecycle. Listed under both Solutions and Platforms on rackspace.com.

name: Application Security Services
description: Services for securing and optimizing web applications including vulnerability assessment, penetration testing, and application-layer security controls. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security on rackspace.com.

name: Zero Trust Services
description: Zero Trust architecture implementation providing secure access anywhere on any device. Foundation for Government Cloud security architecture. Covers identity-based access controls, microsegmentation, and continuous verification. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security.

name: Network Security Services
description: Infrastructure stack protection including firewalls, DDoS mitigation, custom switches, load balancers, domain name system servers, and network segmentation. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security on rackspace.com.

name: Data Protection Services
description: Data loss prevention with compliant data storage solutions. Covers data classification, encryption, access controls, and compliance-aligned data handling for GDPR, HIPAA, PCI DSS environments. Listed under Solutions > Cyber Security on rackspace.com.

name: On-Premises Security Services
description: Securing any environment, any application, and any cloud around the clock for on-premises deployments. Extends security coverage beyond cloud to customer-operated infrastructure. Listed under Platforms > Cyber Security on rackspace.com.

name: FAIR Ideate
description: First phase of the FAIR delivery methodology. Determines organizational AI goals, conducts feasibility evaluation, and assesses AI impact on business operations. Identifies and selects use cases across 500+ catalogued industry use cases. Listed as distinct service on fair.rackspace.com/ideate.

name: FAIR Incubate
description: Second phase of the FAIR delivery methodology. Establishes technology stack, assesses AI viability, ensures integration into organizational processes. Creates first AI solution and determines feasibility of launch. Listed as distinct service on fair.rackspace.com/solutions.

name: FAIR Industrialize
description: Third phase of the FAIR delivery methodology. Systematic transformation of AI solution into production with governance implementation, metric definition, and continuous improvement of distributed cloud infrastructure. Listed as distinct service on fair.rackspace.com/solutions.

name: Agentic AI Solution (FAIR plus Sema4.ai)
description: Enterprise AI agent solution launched June 2025 through strategic alliance with Sema4.ai (announced via GlobeNewswire and NASDAQ press coverage). Integrates FAIR services with Sema4.ai SAFE (Secure, Accurate, Fast, Extensible) AI Agent Platform. Enables rapid deployment of scalable production-ready AI agents across HR, finance, customer support, sales, and operations with governance and security protocols. Rackspace research indicates only 24 percent of enterprises have scaled AI agents in production. Led by Srini Koushik and Rob Bearden (Sema4.ai CEO).

name: Consulting and Advisory Services
description: Cloud strategy consulting and advisory practice spanning multicloud strategy assessment, TCO analysis, and cloud transformation roadmap development. Listed as cross-cutting engagement model across all five solution areas (Cloud, Applications, Data, AI, Security) on rackspace.com. Operated as distinct organizational unit (ou-021).

name: Professional Services
description: Cloud-agnostic professional services for applications modernization, data modernization, security architecture, and cloud infrastructure design-build. Delivered through sprint-based engagements. 11 services for modern cloud infrastructure across AWS, Azure, and GCP. Standardized reference architecture library. Operated as distinct organizational unit (ou-022). 11,000+ total technical certifications. Best Consultancy or System Integrator 2020 (The Cloud Awards).

name: Rackspace Fabric
description: Unified multicloud management platform enabling common governance, ticketing, billing, tagging, and automation across entire IT estate. Includes service delivery automation to self-healing infrastructure. Ensures consistency in customer experiences and enables Rackers to automate key service and application management processes. Drives revenue per employee exceeding $500,000 per 10-K. Registered trademark of Rackspace US Inc. Operated as distinct organizational unit (ou-044).

name: Fanatical Experience
description: Rackspace Technology's trademarked customer experience and support methodology. End-to-end expert engagement from first consultation to daily operations. Registered trademark (Fanatical and Fanatical Experience) per 10-K. Underpins all service delivery. Listed as cross-cutting engagement model across all solution areas on rackspace.com.

name: Disaster Recovery as a Service (DRaaS)
description: Fully managed disaster recovery for on-premises, colocation, and multi-cloud environments. Includes Zerto-powered DRaaS with continuous backup and automated recovery (launched October 2018), custom RTO/RPO SLAs, and SDDC Flex DRaaS variant. Compliance across GDPR, PCI DSS, FISMA, FedRAMP, HITRUST CSF, ISO, SOC 1/2/3 across 30+ global data centers. Also includes Rubrik-powered Cyber Recovery Service.

name: Rackspace Managed Platform for Kubernetes (MPK)
description: Managed Kubernetes-as-a-service powered by Platform9 Managed Kubernetes (PMK). Single pane of glass for deploying and managing clusters across private and public cloud. Dedicated CKA-certified engineer pods. Three application tiers: Managed Applications (full lifecycle), Certified Applications (limited lifecycle), Catalog Applications (community support). Listed under Platforms > Cloud > Kubernetes on rackspace.com.

name: Rackspace Data Freedom
description: Service enabling customers to store data adjacent to the cloud rather than in it. Eliminates public cloud egress fees and avoids cloud vendor lock-in. Available globally across all Rackspace data centers and colocation facilities with connectivity to VMware Cloud, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and more. Registered trademark per 10-K (Rackspace Data Freedom is listed among trademarks).

name: Intelligent Co-worker for the Enterprise (ICE)
description: Purpose-built generative AI accelerator product under the FAIR practice. Announced as part of the October 2024 AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement. Pre-built AI solution for enterprise deployment of conversational AI co-worker capabilities. Available in AWS Marketplace.

name: Rackspace Intelligent Technology Assistant (RITA)
description: Purpose-built generative AI accelerator product under the FAIR practice. Announced alongside ICE as part of October 2024 AWS SCA. Internal-use origin — Rackspace began developing GenAI services in February 2023 for its own customer configuration and technology knowledge base before commercializing. Available in AWS Marketplace.

name: Rackspace Rapid Migration Offer (RRMO)
description: Expedited data center migration service to AWS available on AWS Marketplace. Comprehensive suite covering migration planning, landing zone setup, migration execution, and 24x7x365 post-migration cloud operations with monitoring and incident response. Part of October 2024 AWS SCA.

name: Optimizer+
description: Cloud cost optimization platform providing tailored recommendations, platform support, and custom reporting to maximize ROI. Includes public cloud support services powered by certified engineers, architecture reviews following best practices, escalation management 24x7x365, and large-scale event planning. Referenced in docs.rackspace.com service documentation.

name: FAIR on AWS
description: FAIR AI services delivered on Amazon Web Services platform. Part of multi-year AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement. AWS-validated generative AI industry accelerators available in AWS Marketplace. Leverages AWS services for data foundation building and responsible AI workload operation at scale. Listed as distinct platform on fair.rackspace.com/partners/aws.

name: FAIR on Google Cloud
description: FAIR AI services delivered on Google Cloud Platform. Listed as distinct platform on fair.rackspace.com/partners/google-cloud.

name: FAIR on Microsoft Azure
description: FAIR AI services delivered on Microsoft Azure platform. Listed as distinct platform on fair.rackspace.com/partners/microsoft-azure.

name: Cloud Office
description: Rackspace hosted email and productivity services portfolio encompassing Rackspace Email ($10/mailbox/month), Microsoft Exchange Online hosted ($10.85/mailbox/month), Microsoft 365 managed services, Google Workspace managed, and Rackspace Webmail. Administered via Cloud Office Control Panel. Supports Hybrid plans combining Rackspace Email and Exchange mailboxes on the same domain. 99.999% uptime guarantee. 24x7x365 fanatical support. Reseller program available for hosting providers. Legacy services include Google Apps for Business migration and archival solutions. Operated as distinct Cloud Office department under Jon Mullapudy's Cloud Office Operations scope.
